repnme.cdata!:
Sri Lanka - Economic Restructuring Credit
            and Public Manufacturing Enterprises Adjustments Credit Projects

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Economic
            Restructuring Credit (ERC) and Public Manufacturing
            Enterprises Adjustments Credit (PMEAC) Projects for Sri
            Lanka was satisfactory. The ERC Project achieved most of its
            objectives, its impact on institutional development was
            partially successful, sustainability is likely, and the
            performance of the Bank was satisfactory while the
            Borrower's was marginally satisfactory. The PMEAC
            Project achieved its objectives, its impact on institutional
            development was substantial, sustainability is likely, and
            the performance of both the Bank and Borrower was
            satisfactory. Several lessons can be learned from these
            projects. First, an adjustment effort should focus on
            building broad support for the two or three most important
            policy measures. Second, retrenchment should focus on
            specific categories of employees. Finally, instead of
            attempting to retrench civil servants throughout the
            administration, efforts should be concentrated on those part
            of the administration that have lost their function.

docna.cdata!:
Sri Lanka - Economic Restructuring Credit :
            Credit 2128 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Sri Lanka - Economic
            Restructuring Credit : Credit 2128 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

repnme.cdata!: Sri Lanka - Economic Restructuring Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This Economic Restructuring Credit
            Project will support the Government's efforts aimed at
            stabilizing the economy and implementing structural reforms
            outlined in the second year Policy Framework Paper. In
            addition to addressing the country's serious internal
            and external imbalances, the focus of the Economic
            Restructuring Credit (ERC) is on : 1) the public sector, its
            size, its claims on resources and the efficiency with which
            it uses such resources; 2) the development of the private
            sector through improvements in the existing regulatory
            framework and incentive system and through transfer to the
            private sector of activities and assets now being managed by
            the public sector; and 3) improving the consumption levels
            of the poorest segments of society.
